column4: Hey man, only one request is needed. ANd to install stuff in ubuntu, you need to use the command "sudo aptitude install package-name-here"
Did you catch that?
You install things in Ubuntu with aptitude.
sudo aptitude install rsyslog sounds like a winner.
Google is also your very best friend.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?s=21117cd2e569ace32d857b078b9a61d6&p=4327326#post4327326
lol do i look that stupid..? don't answer that
Well then you should wait until 8.04 :)
Since it's not officially supported, you're going to have a butt load of problems.
If you're still bullheaded and want to install it anyway, you could try building from source.
Adding hardy repos won't... help./
Hardy repos assume you have other dependencies, which you don't.
What's the problem with just waiting for hardy?
i just bought a router which has an option to use SYSLOG. and i want to install and configure rsyslog to capture the router's LOG
Look at what nickrud said. I'd say the same thing.
There are a .... TON of .config files.
Which one are you looking for specifically.
i'm looking for the currently running kernel .config
I guess I don't. Either I just am not that advanced or you have no idea what you're talking about
I would guess debug isn't exactly 'standard' if it's not in the generic kernel
got it
No worries
